title: Swiss LGBTQ groups praise jail sentence for commentator who called journalist a 'fat lesbian'
description: LGBTQ groups hailed the 60-day jail sentence a court in Switzerland gave to writer and commentator Alain Soral for deriding a journalist as a “fat lesbian” and other critical remarks.

title: Several killed after bus plunges from bridge near Venice
description: A bus crashed near the city of Venice after plunging several feet from an elevated street. The spokesperson for Venice’s mayor told NBC News all of the victims, apart from the driver, were tourists.

title: Parents in Pakistan could face prison time for not vaccinating their kids against polio
description: KARACHI, Pakistan — Authorities in one Pakistan province are turning to a controversial new tactic in the decades-long initiative to wipe out polio: prison.

title: At least 20 dead near Venice when bus falls off elevated Italian street
description: A bus crashed near the Italian city of Venice after falling from an elevated street, killing at least 20 people and injuring others Tuesday, authorities said.

title: Teenage suspect arrested after shooting at Bangkok mall leaves 3 dead
description: Police in Thailand arrested a 14-year-old suspected gunman after a shooting at a luxury mall in the capital Bangkok that authorities said killed three people and injured four others.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried faces fraud and money-laundering charges in trial
description: Jury selection is set to begin in the trial against Sam Bankman-Fried, the man known as the “crypto king,” who is accused of looting his FTX cryptocurrency exchange and cheating investors out of an estimated $8 billion to support his hedge fund, buy real estate and make millions in political donations.

title: Police raid news website offices and journalists' homes in India
description: Indian police raided the offices of a news website that is under investigation for allegedly receiving funds from China, as well as the homes of several of its journalists.

title: Greenland women ask Denmark for compensation over involuntary birth control
description: A group of women in Greenland are seeking compensation from Denmark over an involuntary birth control campaign launched in the 1960s, their lawyer said on Monday.

title: 3 scientists win Nobel Prize in physics for looking at electrons in atoms during split seconds
description: The Nobel Prize in physics was awarded Tuesday to three scientists who look at electrons in atoms during the tiniest of split seconds.

title: More than 100 dolphins found dead in Brazilian Amazon rainforest drought
description: Distressing images from Brazil's Amazon rainforest showed the remains of some 100 dolphins that had died as a result of a drought. Scientists believe rising water temperatures are to blame.

title: India police search journalists’ homes and offices in the country’s latest raids on media
description: Indian police raided the offices of NewsClick, a news website accused of receiving funds from China, in what critics described as an attack on press freedom.

title: UN Security Council approves sending a Kenya-led force to Haiti to fight violent gangs
description: The U.N. Security Council voted Monday to send a multinational armed force led by Kenya to Haiti to help combat violent gangs, marking the first time in almost 20 years that a force would be deployed to the troubled Caribbean nation.

title: Bangladesh dengue deaths top 1,000 in worst outbreak
description: The death toll from Bangladesh’s worst dengue outbreak on record has topped 1,000 this year, official data showed.

title: Paris dealing with bedbug infestation ahead of Olympics
description: As Paris prepares to host the 2024 Olympics, the city is ramping up efforts to eradicate bedbugs as the pests have been found in movie theatres, trains, and other public spaces.

title: UN allows deployment of troops to Haiti
description: The United Nations Security Council has approved the deployment of a multinational military force to combat ongoing gang violence in Haiti. NBC’s Valerie Castro explains which countries will be participating and if the U.S. will offer support.

title: At least 10 killed in Mexico church collapse
description: Authorities say the roof of a Catholic church near the port of Tampico caved in while dozens of people were participating in Sunday mass, injuring 60 people and killing 10.
